Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, what more can you ask for!”
Reviews.Author: bellybe
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say this hotel is definately fit for many kinds of animals and humans. Pros: excellent location metres away from the ferry, very pleasant staff, clean, good sized. Cons: Nothing major, NO wifi despite being advertised, had to locate the owners in a nearby hotel before we could check in.

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for animals- do not go!”
Reviews.Author: welltravlelledgirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find hotel not worth of 1 star - rooms and hotel dirty, air conditioner not working- beds sagging. Rooms so tiny you could not fit a suitcase in it. Had my 13year daughter with me and she was so upset to have to stay in this Flea-pit.. Booked for 3 nights but had to leave the next morning. Staff extremely rude- Breakfast stale . On return home find they had charged for an extra night when they said they wouldnt so DO NOT STAY HERE as it will ruin the stay in beautiful Venice. RUDE NASTY PLACE- Beware we had 2 rooms booked and both were the same- so dont stay here. Try the Panorama or the Riveria- next door -quality at the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Joppe84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Giardinetto for five nights in August 2007. We found it to be a good budget hotel for a relatively small price. The location was perfect; from our room we had a great view on Venice and it took only about ten minutes to get to St. Mark's Square. There is a small supermarket just around the corner from the hotel and various places that sell AWESOME icecream and pizza. The staff of the hotel/b&b was very helpful too. One night my girlfriend had a severe headache but we didn't have any painkillers. A member of the staff (I don't remember his name) gave her one. We were also given a device to keep the mosquito's out. The room itself was small and looked dated, but it had everything you need and, more importantly, it was clean. We are visiting Venice again this summer. We really want to stay inside the city itself this time around, but if you're looking for a budget hotel on the Lido with easy access to Venice proper, you can't go wrong with Giardinetto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BUD76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in oct 2008 and loved every minute,the hotel is not great but it is value for money room was ok and kept cleen with very small bathroom,staff were great with the limited english they spoke.Area was fantastic lovely beach just less than 10mins walk down a friendly bar and resteraunt lined street and even in october had a great swim in the sea as weather was still warm.outside the hotel water busses leave every few minutes to the main island,get a pass when you arrive at venice to save money the water bus is the best way to get around. venice is fantastic place to visit and well worth seeing the sites,if you are like me and enjoy an evening drink then choose were you drink carefully as many places dont have public toilets, but dont let that put you off the wonderful sites of venice

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Truutraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel very recently during a quick visit to venice, basically we were only there for 3 days. The hotel itself is located on LIDO a small island opposite ST Marks Sq. The Island is reached either by private taxi (very expensive or 12 euros for public boat, which takes an hour from Marco Polo airport) once you reach LIDO the hotel is only a 2 min walk. Hotel itself is well located in terms of main town area, and restaurants, basically on main strip which feels very safe and the beach is right at the end, a 5 to 10 min walk. But hotel is quite shabby, old musty feel think brighton style hotels, with funkily padded walks, i assume to cover the damp or stains, bathroom as said by other reviewers is tiny, like a walk in closet. Bed wasnt to bad, linen was clean, didnt try the breakfast, literally cornflakes, tea and a few crossiants no toast or fruit or usual hotel fare. If you can find other would advise, hotel belgrade next door looked better!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: emalice
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel for people on a budget, that want a clean and comfortable room. We had a wonderful sea view that overlooked Venice and was very romantic!! The staff and hotel owner were very helpful and friendly, and spoke good English. Right off the Lido stop for the vaporetto. Only problem we had was that the bathroom door was a bit faulty. Other than that this hotel is really good value for money, and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Maid Was the Only Saving Grace”
Reviews.Author: jdotwdot
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to find that they had misplaced our reservation and they had not saved a triple room for us. After being assured that it wasn't a problem we were shown to a tiny double room where we were told they would fit in a cot. This room had had water stains on the wall and smelled terrible. After talking to hotel staff they assured us it would be fine but we were not happy to be paying a triple rate for a double room with a flimsy cot. My wife spoke to the maid and she was the one who convinced the manager to give us a bigger room. We ended up with a two bedroom room where each room had a double. While this was much better, if it wasn't for the maid the manager would have been happy to keep us in a tiny double with a cot but charge us the same rate as a bigger triple room. The hotel is in Lido, not in the main islands of Venice. Its a 40 minute busboat ride to the train station and twenty minutes from the main square in Venice. You can buy day passes or multi-day passes at the train station which make sense. Breakfast was poor and coffee comes from a vending machine rather than being freshly brewed. In retrospect I would spend more on a hotel in the main part of Venice, thereby saving by not having to buy a bus pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LS16
Reviews.Content: Booked Venice for a short break for myself and husband to celebrate my birthday, and also because of the Ryanair sale!! Was worried we may not be able to find a hotel, which meant we didn't have to re-mortgage, found this at a great price and booked it through venere. On arrival the trip to venice from treviso was great, 9 euros return. Once we arrived in venice, managed to get our travel pass and find the right boat to take us to Lido (staff in P.le Roma not very helpful). Would recomend if you aged between 14-29 to purchase a Venice Rolling Card for 4 euros this knocked 20 euros of the price of a 3 day travel pass. Once in Lido the hotel is facing the vaporetto stop, behind the massive monkey (if it is still there!!). The staff were very polite and helpful, rooms basic - but we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. Paid 5 euros for breakfast which wasn't anything speacial but done us until lunch. Had a great nights sleep, the beds are comfy and the rooms are quiet. Lido is lovely, with bars and restaurants (at half the price of Venice). It was very quiet and relaxed compared with Venice, which was great after spending all day fighting through crowds. Overall this hotel is perfect for those who want a great hotel, in a good location that doesn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: FBP60
Reviews.Content: Booked through Venere.com. Loved the location on the Lido - right by the vaporetto, good food nearby, grocery store nearby, beach was 5 minutes walk, etc.. Large room with working A/C. Ensuite was in need cosmetic upgrade but worked OK. For the price this was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, but great location and adequate for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: amanda_clarke
Reviews.Content: I booked via Venere.com- very good for searching for italian hotels. The room was very very small, as was the bathroom, so if you're planning on swinging any cats, don't got here. However, it was clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was a fridge, tv with CNN and a safe. So it was still comfortable and secure. To be fair, most rooms in Italy are small anyway. We paid additional 5 euros for the breakfast, which was simple- juice, coffee, croissants, bread, cereal, yoghurt. The Italians aren't that big on breakfast so don't expect a fry up anywhere. The staff were fairly pleasant and the stay- check in, check out, payment was straight forward and without problems. The room was quiet with no disturbances despite being right opposite the boat stops. Air conditioning was easy to control and the room was nice and dark with the shutters closed so you don't wake up at 6am with the light! The hotel is ideally located, 15 mins boat journey to the centre of Venice and right next to the boat stops. Also close to the main road in Lido which has plenty of restaurants, little shops and ice-cream parlours and leads to the beach. Personally I wasn't that impressed with the beach, was a bit too commercialised, I like beaches to be natural, but its a good beach if you have young kids, very clean. Tip- If at night you don't feel like spendng loads on a meal, go back to Lido, get a couple of beers and a take away pizza from the place on the corner and sit on a bench facing venice to watch the sunset. Overall, good if you're not wanting to spend loads on a hotel that you are just going to sleep in- comfortable, well located, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & low on price”
Reviews.Author: YveyCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem in island of Lido just 30 mins from P. de Roma, ideal for Ryanair flights in from Treviso airport. Lido itself has a large beach and regular water buses into Venice. This hotel had nice clean rooms with air condition. The room was not too big but had a lovely view of Venice from it. The Beach was literally 10 mins away and it was about 35degrees when we were there. There is no lift in the hotel but we were on the 2nd floor which was fine. The staff were very helpful and I would definitely state there again if I was coming to Venice. Beware though the nightlife in Lido is generally quiet unless you go to the nightclub on the beach, but a bacardi & coke will cost you â‚¬10... The hotel is right across the road from the waterbus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - above expectations”
Reviews.Author: KTraveller07
Reviews.Content: Giardinetto Hotel is located on Lido island - about 15 min by boat from the main centre. It exceeded our expectations. It is a 3 star hotel that has really large rooms, big beds and a great bathroom. For the price we paid i was absolutely estatic. We paid Aus $70 per room per night and had a view that overlooked the water. I would definitely recommend this to anyone travelling to Venice. We had breakfast downstairs each morning and our boat stop was directly in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giardinetto is a cosy little and well kept hotel built right in front of the ferry boats with a view on Venice that will take your breath away. My husband and I spent four nights there this January the weather was sunny with a marvellous blue sky even though extremely cold. It was lovely to come to the hotel at night after been out all day and have a small, but lovely warm room to came back to. The hotel does not have a lift so is not recommended for older customer and family with loads of baggage and kids. The room have a small toilette and shower everything in the room was functioning the stuff was helpfull and quite friendly compared to the rest of Venice. I am Italian myself (Romam) and I must say that Veniciance are not the friendliest people I came accross to. In fact the service we've received was horrible in most of the places we have been. Restaurants are extremely expensive, the service is absolutely awful and the food portions are ridiculous, they are not even enough for a bird. If you go to Venice on a small budget Giardinetto at Venice Lido is definitely the place to go, especially in summer, 5 mintus walk to a beautiful and huge beach, the boats run every few minutes for any other destination outside the Lido for a resonable price(22 Euros for 4 days travel pass)also here is much more quite than the center. The best resaturant we found is The Spaghetti house in Burano where food, service and prices were spot on, then there's one restaurant at the Lido on the main street that leads to the beach I don't remenber the name unfortunately, but is the only one on the right pavment next to a little bar. Also quite good are the bars run by Chines they serve cold and hot food at a good price with a better service. Please do not eat at Trattoria Da Nico at San marco the service is absolutely disgraceful, ridicuosly overpriced and there where only 8 spoons of my soup.

Reviews.Title: “What a great city”
Reviews.Author: eck10
Reviews.Content: It's a bit of a haul by vaporetto unless you're going to Piazza San Marco, but other than that the location was great. Our room was large and overlooked the lagoon and was exceptionally soundproof. Our 18-year old daughters shared a much smaller room, but had no complaints especially since the air conditioning worked well. The bathroom is a tight fit if you're bigger than a size 4! The breakfast was typical Italian - a few rolls, but plenty of capuccino. The beach - well to the hear the girls tell it it was absolutely perfect, although it didn't take long to get a burn. And the water was perfect swimming temperature. The trip to Murano is almost 45 minutes and wasn't worth the trip for our taste. Overall, at 65 Euro we were pleased, it was very convenient and we'll come back if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago, and we slightly disappointed. The prices have doubled, the staff was not as friendly and our room was in need of repair. It's still a good deal for Venice. I think next time we will shop for a small hotel on Venice and skip Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, and price!”
Reviews.Author: sykesy116
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in October 2004, while I was attending a conference on the Lido. This was an excellent location. There are nearby restaurants and shopping and the bus to my conference and the vaporettos to St. Marks's and the rest of Venice were right there. The room was small, but clean, and we had a view of the lagoon. The staff did not speak perfect English, but they made an effort. A continental breakfast of hot rolls, croissants, etc. was included each morning, served from 8 to 10. All of this was only 90 euro per night, which is a bargain in Venice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, with 'reservations'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a retired couple staying for 4 nights in very early January. The location of the hotel is excellent, being a stones throw from the boat station on the lagoon onto which the hotel faces. It is a relatively small hotel with various sized rooms. We had asked for a quiet room and were allocated one at the side. It was very small. Whether the other rooms were available to us, we didn't ask. Bedding was clean and the room tidy. We had paid a discounted rate, but if we had paid the 'going rate' we would probably have been disappointed. The hotel seemed to be run on a shoe-string, with several minor defects which could have been fixed easily at small cost. Not up to the usual 3star standard of other european countries, but adequate for the price. The staff were minimal but helpful and friendly. Breakfast was buffet style, limited choice, but no apparent limit to what you had. Very little choice of eateries around, but this may have been a hangover from the Christmas holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in October of 2002. The hotel did not have a lift and the room was small but for the price, you can not do better around Venice. The location is convenient with just a short 10 minute boat ride to P S Marco. The breakfast was good and nice. They have free internet for the guests to use and are right on the water 50 feet from the vaporetto stop LIDO. I have another trip planned and look forward to staying there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giardinetto
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza le Santa Maria Elisabetta 3, 30126 Venice, Italy
